alertitem.name: Content Security Policy (CSP) Header Not Set
alertitem.desc: Content Security Policy (CSP) is an added layer of security that helps to detect and mitigate certain types of attacks, including Cross Site Scripting (XSS) and data injection attacks.
alertitem.solution: Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to set the Content-Security-Policy header.

alertitem.name: X-Content-Type-Options Header Missing
alertitem.desc: The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'.
alertitem.solution: Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.
